meanings.definition: A low, continuous, regular sound resembling that of a rapidly revolving object.
meanings.sent1: The whirrs of the fan filled the room with a soothing hum.
meanings.sent2: I heard the whirrs of the helicopter as it flew overhead.
meanings.sent3: The whirrs of the old washing machine made it seem like it was singing a lullaby.
meanings.sent4: The whirrs of the wind turbines echoed across the vast field.
meanings.sent5: The whirrs of the distant train grew louder as it approached the station.

meanings.definition: To make a low, continuous, regular sound resembling that of a rapidly revolving object.
meanings.sent1: The machine whirrs softly as it operates in the background.
meanings.sent2: She whirrs the toy airplane around her head, making airplane noises.
meanings.sent3: The cat whirrs happily as it chases after a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The bicycle whirrs as the wheels spin rapidly down the hill.
meanings.sent5: He whirrs the drill to life, ready to start working on the project.
